bioghist.p: Ronald R. Stockton is a professor of political science at the University of Michigan-Dearborn. He writes and teaches about the role of religion and religious values in the United States and abroad. Many of his writings relate to Arab American relations, especially in the Detroit area. Other writings concern comparative non-western politics, especially ethnic conflict, political change, and the Israeli-Palestinian conflict.

scopecontent.p: The Ronald R. Stockton collection consists of various writings, most on topics relating to his research and teaching interests. These topics include Arab American relations, religion, historical and genealogical subjects, and articles about Kenya.

In 2000, Ronald Stockton began a journal which was intended to be read by his descendents. In it, he wrote of his daily activities interspersed with reflections on current events. In his journal, Stockton wrote of his daily activities interspersed with reflections on current events. This journal dates from 2000 to 2005 and continues with 2010. This journal is currently closed to research until 2025.
